responsibilities: Work on prototype boards for automotive, aerospace, and personal computers
Build and maintain the EE test lab, including sourcing and setting up testing equipment
Run maintenance and calibration tasks for oscilloscopes, DAQs, power sources, sensors, load simulators, and digital communication interfaces
Design and build automatic test execution scripts/software and integrate into the ATLAS product platform
Test, debug, and root cause PCB failures using the EE test lab and standard tooling
Expand the test lab to improve controls and measurement for common failure modes
Serve as the domain expert and primary collaborator with software engineering and ML teams
Travel domestically and internationally (up to 25% of the time)
Work in person at Arena's NYC headquarters when not traveling
qualifications: Ability to design, build, and test circuits
Experience with prototype boards and commercial PCBs
Proficiency in setting up and maintaining testing equipment
Skills in designing and building automatic test execution scripts/software
Experience in testing, debugging, and root causing PCB failures
Familiarity with standard EDA and simulation tools (Cadence, Synopsys, Ansys)
Knowledge of SPICE, PDN, and Verilog-AMS
Familiarity with debugging and root causing EMI/EM parasitics
Programming/scripting skills in Python, NI LabView, Matlab
Ability to work in team environments
Hands-on and eager to build things from 0 to 1
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills listed are primarily focused on electrical engineering tasks, such as designing, building, and testing circuits (PCBs), working with prototype boards, maintaining testing equipment, and debugging PCB failures. The role also involves designing and building automatic test execution scripts/software, which suggests some level of software development, but it is specifically related to testing and hardware integration. The skills required include proficiency in EDA and simulation tools, programming/scripting skills in Python, NI LabView, and Matlab, and knowledge of SPICE, PDN, and Verilog-AMS. 

While there is a mention of collaboration with software engineering and ML teams, there is no explicit mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The focus is on hardware and testing, rather than on AI or language model development or application. Therefore, the job does not appear to involve working with GenAI or LLMs.
